justification: The Methods section states: “We used the Berlin Numeracy Test (BNT; Cokely et al., 2012). BNT contains four tasks requiring the use of statistical and probability information,” indicating BNT operationalizes statistical numeracy.
It is reported that “Subjective numeracy was measured with the eight-item Subjective Numeracy Scale (Fagerlin et al., 2007),” showing the SNS is the instrument for subjective numeracy.
The authors write, “We used the Math Anxiety Questionnaire for Adults (MAQA; Szczygieł, 2022)” to assess math anxiety, directly linking the construct to the MAQA measure.

measured_by: Berlin Emotional Responses to Risk Instrument (BERRI) – positive component
justification: Under Affect positivity they explain: “We used the BERRI… The BERRI scale contains six adjectives (positive: assured, hopeful, relieved…),” specifying that the positive component of BERRI measures affect positivity.

measured_by: Berlin Emotional Responses to Risk Instrument (BERRI) – negative component
justification: The same section notes the negative adjectives (anxious, afraid, worried) within BERRI and later analyses refer to “negative component of the BERRI scale,” evidencing its use to capture affect negativity.

The Design describes a “Lottery task” with 10 items where “The correctness of the chosen option… was evaluated in terms of EV,” showing this task operationalizes decision-making accuracy regarding expected value.
